sentences.sContent: "In anthropology, you can't equate third gender with homosexuality," he said.
sentences.sContent_eng: "In anthropology, you can't equate third gender with homosexuality," he said.
sentences.sCn: “在人类学中，你不能将同性恋和第三性别混同，”他说。

sentences.sContent: When I was a student at Cambridge I remember an anthropology professor holding up a picture of a bone with 28 incisions carved in it.
sentences.sContent_eng: When I was a student at Cambridge I remember an anthropology professor holding up a picture of a bone with 28 incisions carved in it.
sentences.sCn: 当我还在剑桥读书的时候，我记得有一位人类学的教授拿出一张照片，上面是一根有28个切口的骨头。

sentences.sContent: Not to be the skunk at this party, but I think it's important to ask whether neuroscience reveals anything more than we already know from, say, anthropology.
sentences.sContent_eng: Not to be the skunk at this party, but I think it's important to ask whether neuroscience reveals anything more than we already know from, say, anthropology.
sentences.sCn: 我并不想成为派对上的讨厌鬼，但我认为很重要的是，要问清楚神经科学是否揭示出我们已知之外的东西，比如人类学。

phrases.pCn: 人类体格学；身体人类学
进化人类学；演化的人类学

remMethod.val: anthrop(人， 人类) + ology(…学) → 人类学

words.tran: 人为的；[人类] 人类起源的
以人类为中心的；以人类观点解释宇宙万物的
类人猿的；类人的；（猿等）似人类的
人类起源学的；人类起源的
人类本位说；人类中心说

trans.tranOther: the scientific study of people, their societies,  culture s  etc
